content: Extensions are developed and supported by their independent authors. When upgrading releases, those authors sometimes require extra time to complete their addon upgrades. The thunderbird team keeps them aware of upcoming changes, but the authors control their own timeline. Thunderbird has always held the position that profiles are subject to changes when upgrading to new releases.
creator: davidsk

content:
Check is Thunderbird really running ? Right click on the Taskbar and select 'Task Manager' Is Thunderbird running? If yes, select Thunderbird and click on 'End Task'

If it is not running then it not running, but Thunderbird might think it's running so do this.

  • In Windows search type: %Appdata%
  • Select %Appdata% file folder
  • Select 'Roaming' folder
  • Select 'Thunderbird' folder
  • Select 'Profiles' folder
  • Select the profile name folder - typically it looks something like this : abc2d234.default

In the profile name folder

  • Look for a file called 'parent.lock' and delete it.

Then try to start Thunderbird.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Aynı ayarların Outlook'ta çalışması ilginç. Loglarınıza bir bakalım.

Menü > Ayarlar > Genel sayfasının en altında "Yapılandırma düzenleyici"ye tıklayın.

mailnews.smtp.loglevel tercihini Warn yerine All olarak değiştirin.

Ardından Menü > Araçlar > Geliştirici araçları'nı açıp Konsol seçmesine geçin. Şimdi bir e-posta göndermeyi deneyin ve oluşan logların ekran görüntüsünü burada paylaşın.

İşlem bittikten sonra mailnews.smtp.loglevel tercihini geri alabilirsiniz.

content:
the profile includes everything unless user has consciously make changes. Here are general steps for backup and copying (for Windows):

here is the info in brief steps:

BACKUP

  1. ensure thunderbird is not running
  2. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  3. this should open windows file explorer in Appdata\roaming folder
  4. highlight the Thunderbird folder and copy to external media

RESTORE

  1. ensure thunderbird is installed and NOT running
  2. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  3. you should be in Appdata\roaming folder , copy&paste the exported Thunderbird folder there. This may prompt to overwrite an existing folder of same name. allow it
  4. start thunderbird and all should be there
creator: davidsk

content: Thanks but ... what does "unless user has consciously make changes" cover? I created a bunch of local folders to archive messages and de-clutter what's online. Do these folders form part of the Profile or do I need to find and copy them separately?

content: No, you're fine. Some users create folders outside of the profile and then change links in thunderbird. Infrequent, but it happens. You're safe in what you're doing.

content:
Le risposte vengono date solo attraverso il forum non a indirizzi di email.

Informazioni utili da fornire nelle richieste al forum:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)
creator: @next

content: Problem solved. I wasn't seeing the folder pane at all. All I saw was the Inbox. The folder pane had gotten compressed into the left margin and wasn't visible. When I slowly moved the cursor over the left margin and got the double horizontal arrow, I then knew what had happened, and stretched it back into visibility. Sorry everyone, for my stupidity. But your comments helped me figure it out, so thank you!
